dt: {bc}an experience associated with the definite and decisive adoption of a religion
{bc}the operation of finding a {a_link|converse} in logic or mathematics
{bc}reduction of a mathematical expression by clearing of fractions
{bc}a successful attempt for a point or points especially after a touchdown or for a first down
{bc}something converted from one use to another

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French, from Latin {it}conversion-, conversio{/it}, from {it}convertere{/it}
shortdef: the act of converting : the process of being converted
an experience associated with the definite and decisive adoption of a religion
the operation of finding a converse in logic or mathematics

dt: {bc}a genetic process that involves nonreciprocal meiotic recombination in heterozygotes in which a mismatched DNA sequence from one heteroduplex DNA strand is replaced with a sequence complementary to the other strand resulting in aberrant gametic ratios (such as 3:1) and that is observed especially in ascomycetous fungi

shortdef: a genetic process that involves nonreciprocal meiotic recombination in heterozygotes in which a mismatched DNA sequence from one heteroduplex DNA strand is replaced with a sequence complementary to the other strand resulting in aberrant gametic ratios (such as 3:1) and that is observed especially in ascomycetous fungi
